bibl.title: Howard McMillen v. O. D. Butterfield. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
IN THE DISTRICT COURT, Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the Counties of King and Kitsap.
HABEAS CORPUS.
The People of the United States of America, to the O. D. Butterfield Cheif of Police Sheriff of King County Greeting:
We command you, that you have the body of Howard McMillen by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Howard McMillen shall be called or chagred, before the HON. C H Hanford ROGER S. GREENE Judge of the aforesaid Court at in the Court Room of said Court, forthwith to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning him the said Howard McMillen And have you then and there this writ. C H Hanford WITNESS THE HON. C H Hanford ROGER S. GREENE Judge of said District Court, and the seal thereof this 11th day of May A. D. 1889 R. M. Hopkins James Seavey Clerk. By H. T. Harmon Deputy.
Court fail

Territory of Washington County of King ss.
J. H. McGraw Sheriff of King County, W. T.do hereby certify that on the 11th day of May, 1889, I read for service a writ, of which the within is a true copy, and that a personally served the same on the same day on O. D. Butterfiel, Chief of Police, he bring the person to whom said writ was directed, by delivering to him, said Chief of Police, personally, in said King County, said writ. Seattle, May 11th 1889. Sheriff Fees; J. H. McGraw Service 1.00 Sheriff Copy 80 By Deputy 3 mile 20 Return 50 $2.50

E No. 6776 T
Habeas Corpus
FILED May 17 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. By H. T. Harmon Deputy Clerk.
